trans-unit.source: Step 1: Create a Service Namespace for the REST Queue and Topic/Subscription Tutorial
trans-unit.target: Step 1: Create a Service Namespace for the REST Queue and Topic/Subscription Tutorial

trans-unit.source: This is the first of nine tasks required to create a basic REST-based <token>sb1</token> queue and topic/subscription service.
trans-unit.target: This is the first of nine tasks required to create a basic REST-based <token>sb1</token> queue and topic/subscription service.

trans-unit.source: The first step is to create a <token>servicensd</token>, and to obtain a <externalLink><linkText>Shared Access Signature</linkText><linkUri>https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn170477.aspx</linkUri></externalLink> (SAS) key.
trans-unit.target: The first step is to create a <token>servicensd</token>, and to obtain a <externalLink><linkText>Shared Access Signature</linkText><linkUri>https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn170477.aspx</linkUri></externalLink> (SAS) key.

trans-unit.source: A <token>servicensd</token> provides an application boundary for each application exposed through <token>sb2</token>.
trans-unit.target: A <token>servicensd</token> provides an application boundary for each application exposed through <token>sb2</token>.

trans-unit.source: A SAS is automatically generated by the system when a <token>servicensd</token> is created.
trans-unit.target: A SAS is automatically generated by the system when a <token>servicensd</token> is created.

trans-unit.source: The combination of <token>servicensd</token> and SAS key provides a credential for <token>sb2</token> to authenticate access to an application.
trans-unit.target: The combination of <token>servicensd</token> and SAS key provides a credential for <token>sb2</token> to authenticate access to an application.

trans-unit.source: How to: Create a Service Namespace for Queues, Topics, and Subscriptions
trans-unit.target: How to: Create a Service Namespace for Queues, Topics, and Subscriptions

trans-unit.source: To create a service namespace and obtain a shared secret key
trans-unit.target: To create a service namespace and obtain a shared secret key

trans-unit.source: For complete information about how to create a <token>servicensd</token>, see the topic <link xlink:href="fa561f70-007c-45aa-b34d-56317dbbfc87" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to: Create or Modify a Service Bus Service Namespace</link> in the <link xlink:href="95fd7efd-7a4b-49c8-8eea-297d24c9ee08" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Managing Service Bus Service Namespaces</link> section.
trans-unit.target: For complete information about how to create a <token>servicensd</token>, see the topic <link xlink:href="fa561f70-007c-45aa-b34d-56317dbbfc87" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to: Create or Modify a Service Bus Service Namespace</link> in the <link xlink:href="95fd7efd-7a4b-49c8-8eea-297d24c9ee08" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Managing Service Bus Service Namespaces</link> section.

trans-unit.source: In the main window of the Azure management portal, click the name of the <token>servicensd</token> you created in the previous step.
trans-unit.target: In the main window of the Azure management portal, click the name of the <token>servicensd</token> you created in the previous step.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>shared access key generator</ui> section, make a note of the <ui>Primary Key</ui> associated with the <ui>RootManageSharedAccessKey</ui> policy, or copy it to the clipboard.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>shared access key generator</ui> section, make a note of the <ui>Primary Key</ui> associated with the <ui>RootManageSharedAccessKey</ui> policy, or copy it to the clipboard.

trans-unit.source: You will use this value later in this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: You will use this value later in this tutorial.
